alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm producing heavy rain will impact portions of Forsyth and northeastern Davidson Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms producing heavy rain along a line extending from near Clemmons to near Kernersville. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Multiple rounds of storms have produced heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain may cause isolated flooding especially in poor drainage locations. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, High Point, Kernersville, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Huntsville, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall and Pfafftown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
